comment: hi . thanks for ur content im enjoying studying biology now
In slides most of photos are missing for some reason
Hello, thanks for your content, could you please update the pdf link in the description, as it doesn’t seem to work and it would be of great help. Sorry to bother you, great lectures.
Hello Is it true that all cell membranes have sugar molecules on them? Or just immune cells?
strange. I'll check. You might want to download and see if they show up. Sometimes if the file is large it won't show up correctly online.
It works, thank you so much keep up the good work❤

Yes, membranes have sugars embedded in them on either as part of lipids (glycolipids) or on membrane proteins (glycoproteins) after post translational modification. These sugars are essential for those proteins and lipids to maintain their function. Many diseases and disorders including cancer will show modifications. additions or deletions of these sugars.
